bestBHT.bht: When Jesus said, Now from the fig tree learn the parable, he was using the example of the fig tree to teach an important lesson. In the same way that you can discern the nearness of a season from the coming forth of leaves on a fig tree, you should be all the more alert and discerning when you see the sure and awful signs that indicate the approach of the end. Just as the fig tree's branch is yet tender and puts forth leaves, so do these signs indicate the nearness of the end. So pay attention to these signs, for they are significant.

Henry Alford: If in so humble an example as the fig-tree you discern the nearness of a season, much rather should you in these sure and awful signs discern the approach of the end.
If in so humble an example as the fig-tree you discern the nearness of a season...
Much rather should you in these sure and awful signs discern the approach of the end.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: Now from the fig tree learn the parable, the high lesson which this teaches.
When her branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, its leaves.
Marvin Vincent: Parable. See on Matthew 24:32. Branch. See on Mark 11:8.
Archibald T. Robertson: Coming to pass (γινομενα). Present middle participle, linear action. See on Matthew 24:32-36 for details of verses Mark 13:28-32 (the Parable of the Fig Tree).
John Gill: Now learn a parable of the fig tree...
when her branch is yet tender... and putteth forth leaves...
ye know, that summer is near...

bhtAttempts.bht: When Jesus said, Now from the fig tree learn the parable, he was using the example of the fig tree to teach an important lesson. In the same way that you can discern the nearness of a season from the coming forth of leaves on a fig tree, you should be all the more alert and discerning when you see the sure and awful signs that indicate the approach of the end. Just as the fig tree's branch is yet tender and puts forth leaves, so do these signs indicate the nearness of the end. So pay attention to these signs, for they are significant.

When Jesus said, Now from the fig tree learn the parable, he used the example of the fig tree to teach a powerful lesson. By observing the humble fig tree, one can discern the nearness of a season, and in the same way, it is even more crucial to recognize the sure and awful signs that signify the approach of the end. Just like the tender branches of a fig tree putting forth leaves, these signs indicate the imminent end. Pay heed to these signs, for they hold great significance.

When Jesus said to learn a parable from the fig tree, He was instructing us to discern the nearness of a season from its signs. Just as the fig tree's branches put forth leaves, signifying the nearness of summer, we should be alert to the sure and awful signs that indicate the approach of the end. By paying attention to these signs, we gain greater understanding of the season that is to come, preparing ourselves for what lies ahead.

From the parable of the fig tree, we learn that discerning the nearness of a season can be as simple as observing its signs. Just as the fig tree's leaves reveal the approach of summer, we should be all the more attentive to the sure and awful signs that indicate the end is near. By recognizing these signs, we gain insight into the imminent arrival of a significant season, allowing us to prepare and navigate what lies ahead.

In the parable of the fig tree, Jesus teaches us an important lesson about discernment. By using the example of the fig tree, he demonstrates that just as we can identify the nearness of a season by seeing its leaves, we should be even more aware of the signs that indicate the nearing end. These signs are sure and awful, and by paying attention to them, we can understand the approaching end and its significance. It is crucial for us to be attentive and prepared for what is to come.
